reviews.productTitle: Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch | for Philips Hue Smart Bulbs | Z3-1BRL-WH-L0 | White
reviews.text: We've accumulated a good many of the Philips hue lights. This switch is great for those. Using some kind of voodoo magic it just pops on over the top of your regular light switch. They've held up really well. If this company made the same exact thing except with the center button a little more pronounced, then I would pay for that. Every now and then when you mean to hit just the center button you hit the spinning ring around the outside of it. Not a huge problem but I'm sure other people have big clumsy fingers too.

reviews.title: Excellent option for the Philips Hue lights

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch | for Philips Hue Smart Bulbs | Z3-1BRL-WH-L0 | White
reviews.text: These Lutron dimmers work well if you use them with bulbs that are controlled by the Philips Hue bridge. However, if you are hoping that you can connect directly to Home Assistant and control any of your smart bulbs then you are in for a lot of frustration. The experience is buggy and works inconsistently. They don't claim to be able to do any of that so I am only docking one star.

reviews.text: Corrected wiring issue in master bath. Our plug no longer turns off with light. Only issue is the dimmer was shipped new in box with defective battery. Once a new battery was installed it works great! Updates: contacted Lutron since battery needs replacing every 3 days. They said they would ship replacement within 2-3 days. That was on 1/29. It’s 2/5 and had to follow up with Lutron. They said it won’t ship until 2/10. In the meantime I have gone through 4 batteries to keep the switch working. Not happy!!!!

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch | for Philips Hue Smart Bulbs | Z3-1BRL-WH-L0 | White
reviews.text: I have Hue bulbs installed throughout my house, and I absolutely love them. However, my home is outfitted with standard wired switches in every room, which can cause a few issues. While voice control is convenient, flipping a light switch when entering a room often feels more natural. Unfortunately, when smart lights are connected to traditional switches, turning the switch off takes the bulbs offline. This makes them unavailable for voice commands, automations, or routines. Worse yet, it disrupts the flow of controlling all the lights in a room—turning the switch back on only reactivates the power, not the smart functionality. This dimmer solves that problem perfectly. It prevents the lights from being accidentally turned off while seamlessly integrating with the existing wall plate. The design is clean and simple, and the installation is straightforward. I explored alternatives like the Hue Dimmer Switch, but it presented a couple of challenges. Using it would require either adding a separate plate alongside my existing switch or rewiring the wall switch to tie the wires together and then installing the Hue Dimmer over it. Both options seemed cumbersome or overly invasive. In contrast, this dimmer offers a much cleaner and more practical solution. There’s also the Hue Wall Switch Module, which serves a similar purpose. However, it requires dismantling the wall switch and connecting wires to achieve functionality, making it more complex to install. Additionally, the Wall Switch Module only provides basic on/off functionality, whereas this Lutron switch offers multiple features, including dimming and switching between scenes. For me, the added versatility of this dimmer makes it the clear winner. If I have one complaint, it’s the price. While I believe the quality and functionality justify the cost, it becomes a bit painful when you need several of these switches throughout the house. A multi-pack—perhaps a 4-pack with a 20% discount—would make it much easier to outfit an entire home without breaking the bank. Overall, this dimmer is a fantastic solution for managing smart lights in a home with traditional switches. It simplifies lighting control, eliminates offline bulb errors, and offers more functionality than other options. While it’s an investment, the convenience and seamless integration make it well worth considering.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2024
reviews.title: Excellent Solution for Smart Lights and Dumb Switches

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch | for Philips Hue Smart Bulbs | Z3-1BRL-WH-L0 | White

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch | for Philips Hue Smart Bulbs | Z3-1BRL-WH-L0 | White
reviews.text: One of the complications with using Hue bulbs controlled via app is that visitors don't have access to the app. They could use Alexa to control the lights, but they don't know the commands or the names of the rooms and bulbs and it's complicated to provide lists. Also, how do they find the list in the dark? Philips makes wall-mounted controls, but I prefer the Lutron control because it mimics standard dimmer light switches. A person walking into a dark room and feeling this switch will know to push it in and/or turn it. We use each switch to control the bedside lamps in a bedroom. We also provide Hue Wireless Smart Light Switch Buttons at each lamp so that guests can control the lamps without getting out of bed or using their voice. Who wants to issue voice commands to Alexa while someone is asleep in the room?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2024
reviews.title: simplifies use of Hue bulbs for visitors

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch | for Philips Hue Smart Bulbs | Z3-1BRL-WH-L0 | White
reviews.text: The new series of friends of Hue products truly live up to their name. Luton is making it super easy to control every room that I have in the Philips Hue ecosystem. It’s super hard to get someone who doesn’t understand you to get with the taps or with any of the controls that Philips has meticulously tried to introduce. Clearly, Luton understands what Philips is doing, and they live up to the task of making it super super easy to install, integrate into your home apps and are now every room in my house where I have Philips Hue bulbs. I can’t speculate about long-term use since I just installed them, but if they’re even close to what Philips is doing with their accessories, these are a game changer.

reviews.title: An invaluable addition to my philips hue ecosystem.

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch | for Philips Hue Smart Bulbs | Z3-1BRL-WH-L0 | White
reviews.text: If you are planning to use it with a Hue hub or bulbs directly, skip this review. I connected it to Home Assistant via zigbee2mqtt, and it’s a mixed experience. First, hardware itself is awesome - it sits on top of the switch and works as intended. But the problem is that it’s stateful. Meaning, if you only control your lights with this device and never through home assistant without this device, it will work fine. But if you change your light state from your HA and then continue using this dimmer, results will be unexpected. It remembers its own state but is not aware of the lights state, and it only sends brightness based on its own state. It doesn’t send click messages or dimming increase/decrease messages, only brightness. So, once you do something with the light from your Home assistant, dimmer state is invalid. I wrote a huge script to handle this. The script remembers last known dimmer brightness and tries to guess what new brightness means - click or something else. If new brightness is 0, it’s the biggest problem- you don’t know if it’s a click or dimming down. Quite possible it’s a click and the user wants to turn the light on if you previously turned the light off with the app but the dimmer thinks it’s on, but could be dimming down as well. There are many other problematic scenarios. I made the script work for most cases but it’s not possible to mitigate them all. I wish the device would just send stateless messages about what was done with it.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2024
reviews.title: Good but be warned

reviews.text: I paired this Zigbee device to a Zi-Stick from Aeotec running on my Home Assistant. It controls groups of lights such as lifx bulbs or other zigbee bulbs fine for the dimmer dial. However it does not register events from button presses. It does sometimes register a button press and works as expected when doing so, but this happens at an unreliable rate maybe 1 in 15 button presses. Either I received a defective product or this just doesn't work or is non-standard zigbee in some way. For the cost of this item I expected it to work flawlessly and reliably.

reviews.title: Button doesn't work, dimmer dial works

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch | for Philips Hue Smart Bulbs | Z3-1BRL-WH-L0 | White
reviews.text: I've gone through a couple of similar products. The idea is: I have a light switch that controls a ceiling fixture which contains Hue smart bulbs. This covers the switch, locking it in the "on" position so the smart bulbs always get power. This button sends on/off and dimming signals to the smart bulbs. It does those things flawlessly! Pros: - it's easy to install (non-destructively - it clamps over a light switch with fitting that you tighten with a screw). - it works really well - the lights respond quickly and reliably. - it's surprisingly low profile. A visitor would be unlikely to realize it's anything more than a standard dimmer switch. Cons: - it's pricey - works for Hue bulbs only. I'd like to be able to control Z-Wave, Matter, SmartThings devices, etc. - in case your home network was down, I wish you could pop the dimmer off the wall and change the switch position without a screwdriver.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2024
reviews.title: Reliable and easy to install, just pricey and limited to Hue

reviews.text: This is indeed a great idea to mount over a traditional toggle switch. The push on/off and rotary work great. What does not work is selecting “natural light” scene. You can apparently pick any scene, except for that one. Natural Light is the one scene that I most want to use. Apparently that’s a Philips bridge limitation. It was announced over a year ago that Natural Light would be enabled for Aurora switches in 2023…..but it’s 2024 and nothing yet. I guess I’ll keep this, but I’m not sure where I’m going to use it since it won’t work with the scene I use most often.

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch | for Philips Hue Smart Bulbs | Z3-1BRL-WH-L0 | White
reviews.text: I bought five of these for my house because I loved that they would let the light switch stay but cover it up. And in the end, the ones I have look great (plus Hue products just work better than any other I have tried with Homekit—always respond quickly if you have a hub). HOWEVER, when you get to the final install step and you push the dial onto the mount, it has to go on PERFECTLY balanced and very very gently. The first one I installed didn't go on evenly, the top locked in and the bottom didn't snap, so i pushed on the bottom and the insides just collapsed in a junk pile of innards. The button didn't push, the dial was uneven. Pulled it off tried again, but now it was clearly straight up broken. Before I returned it, I went to install the others... so I took the dial from another box and it snapped perfectly on the mount both sides at once. Okay, 1 for 2... must be an anomaly, right? Next install, gently, bottom snaps in, top doesn't. Pull it off, try again, collapsed. Broken completely. No button push, no blinking light. Everything crushed in. Pulled off again, tried to carefully "fix it". Nope. Take another dial, snaps right on, no problem. Next, broke. Next one after that, broke. Uh oh. 2 for 5. Not good. Sent the three back. But bought three more at a brick and mortar to save time. Two broke, one didn't. 3 for 7. Returned the two broken ones. Got two more, one broke, one didn't. 4 for 8. Next, broke. Took it back again. 4 for 9. Next, broke. 4 for 10. But at this point, I had the last one from the store, so I decided to actually fix it this time. Nope. Not a chance. These are cheap, delicate, and incredibly fragile, so it just got worse and worse, until it was not even returnable. At that point, I gave up on having the fifth at all and just swallowed the money—vowing to never get these again and to write a review to help others decide if they are the gambling type or not. I do love the four I successfully installed, but it was very hard to get there and 100% a game of chance on the dial install—which, of course, led to multiple returns and then eating the price of one altogether. So I absolutely cannot recommend these. It's not worth the risk for me to ever go through this again. However, if you really want the end result and you're willing to go through a potential cycle of frustration and wasted time, you may be happy when it's all said and done. Just don't say I didn't warn you.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.title: Looks great, works well if you have a lucky install, but it is EXTREMELY FRAGILE.

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch | for Philips Hue Smart Bulbs | Z3-1BRL-WH-L0 | White
reviews.text: I think "Friends of Hue" is an understatement. This device is Hue's Best Friend! It's so easy to set up, I'm shocked at how easy it is. It was so easy that at first I thought "maybe I did it wrong", then I thought "maybe it's bootleg", and then finally, I pressed the button and turned it left and right. And voilà! Installed in less than 5 minutes. Within that 5 minutes, it took longer for me to find a Phillips screwdriver than to install the device! You will need to read the instructions just to mount the base onto your existing wall switch. But the rest was a piece of cake. The Hue app even has this device right at the top of the Friends of Hue Accessories setup menu! Overall, I highly recommend it. The Hue ecosystem is already expensive on its own so this doesn't really break the bank.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.title: Hue's Best Friend!

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch | for Philips Hue Smart Bulbs | Z3-1BRL-WH-L0 | White
reviews.text: Pairing these switches to your Hue Hub can be difficult or super easy, and there’s really no way to tell until you start. It seems like there are at least a couple versions of firmware floating around in the wild, only one of which matches the instructions for pairing. Once paired, they do function well as a replacement light switch, mostly. When I added a new bulb, I had the darndest time trying to get the switch to turn the new bulb on, though it would turn it off just fine. My biggest issue with these switches, besides the cost, is that they don’t really stay attached to the switch toggle all that well. Even when tightened down like crazy, they’re relatively easy to pull off of the wall. Even just tryin to pull the button off of the mount to change the battery will usually pull the mount off with it.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.title: Cool, but expensive

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch | for Philips Hue Smart Bulbs | Z3-1BRL-WH-L0 | White
reviews.text: Everyone besides myself in my household ALWAYS flips the switch off for my smart lights making them useless. I bought the Hue lights retrofit kit for my kitchen (6 lights) and ran across this item. My only complaint (very slight complaint) is the dimming feature is a little slow to respond so I have to take off .1 stars making this a 4.9. With that said the ease of install and convenience easily adds .1 stars. I give it a 5 out of 5 stars. I only have 1 switch for my kitchen lights so this was a perfect solution to an annoying problem and a heck of a lot easier than changing the switch out. I would definity buy another if I had 2 light switches. A cheaper option is buying a cover to prevent you from turning the switch off, but this lets you have access to turning on and off the lights and dimming them, plus it looks like it was made for this. It does not control light colors but I have Alexa for that (she is spying on me anyway). I was 100% satisfied with this purchase.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.title: ingenious

So much more touch sensitive and squishy than your standard good ol trusty dimmer switch from before this smart bulb nonsense. Please improve this design and this will be a perfect product

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch | for Philips Hue Smart Bulbs | Z3-1BRL-WH-L0 | White
reviews.text: The Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch is a great way to control your Philips Hue bulbs. It is a simple, easy-to-use switch that allows you to turn your lights on and off, dim them, and create different scenes. The Aurora switch is easy to install, and it works with all Philips Hue bulbs. I love the fact that the Aurora switch allows me to dim my Philips Hue bulbs. This is great for creating a more relaxed atmosphere in my home. I also love the fact that I can create different scenes with the Aurora switch. For example, I have a scene called "Goodnight" that dims my lights and turns on my bedroom fan. Overall, I am very happy with the Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch. It is a great way to control your Philips Hue bulbs, and it is easy to use. I highly recommend it.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2023
reviews.title: No more switches being manually turned off

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch | for Philips Hue Smart Bulbs | Z3-1BRL-WH-L0 | White
reviews.text: I love these!!! Makes it super easy to keep people from flipping switches in my house I don’t want them to use. I’ve paired them with Hue Philips lights and they have been really reliable and easy to use. I’ve been buying them for years, I have a lot these days. Pretty great battery life.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2023
reviews.title: Love these.

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch | for Philips Hue Smart Bulbs | Z3-1BRL-WH-L0 | White
reviews.text: Set two of these with Hue and they work, until they do not and have to be reset and re-installed… and a few days later… reset and re-installed… and a few days later… and a few days later… and a few days later… and a few days later… and a few days later… and a few days later… and a few days later… and a few days later… and a few days later…
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2023
reviews.title: In theory good but…

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch | for Philips Hue Smart Bulbs | Z3-1BRL-WH-L0 | White
reviews.text: Are you like me, a Dad who invested too much $$$ into smart home tech to make life simpler only to want to pull your hair out when your little ones turn off the light switches in the house making you yell at Alexa and not get the result you want?? If this is you then this Lutron light switch solves that lol I bought one of these for our living room Philips Hue lights just to protect my precious Alexa overlord from not giving me the response i want when i ask the simple question to turn off the lights and prevent a device is unresponsive error message. As an added bonus, it can allow you to synch multiple lights to the dimmer switch so you can dim the lights to a low setting in case you want a more hands-on approach to controlling your lights. Simply put, if you own Philips Hue light bulbs then this is the product you need. If you rent and want to get more fancy in your rental then it's a must!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2023
reviews.title: Solves a simple but annoying problem with Phillips Hue Smart Lightbulbs.

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch | for Philips Hue Smart Bulbs | Z3-1BRL-WH-L0 | White
reviews.text: These work inconsistently at best, and after four of them, I can say conclusively that they don’t last. Lutron replaced one for me after it died, and then the replacement died a few weeks later. Replaced batteries (which shouldn’t be an issue after only a couple of weeks, plus the white light still blinks when you press or spin it). Just doesn’t really work reliably. Spin it or press the button, and lights don’t come on. Since I end up having to use the Hue app almost all the time anyways, I really wish I wouldn’t have wasted my money on these.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2023
reviews.title: Garbage. Don’t waste your money

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Aurora Smart Bulb Dimmer Switch | for Philips Hue Smart Bulbs | Z3-1BRL-WH-L0 | White
reviews.text: I bought this so there was a physical way to turn my hue lights on, off, and dim them for house/dog sitters who aren’t in our HomeKit Home. You can turn lights on and dim them, but you cannot turn them off. The knob will also not sit flush with any of the four backplates I’ve tried with it. The knob will not turn lights off when it’s fully removed from the backplate either. All of my Lutron caseta switches are flawless, but it seems the Aurora (or at least this one) is a dud
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2023
reviews.title: Cannot turn lights off
